text:
ce="preserve">This is a list of BAFTA Award winners for Best Makeup and Hair. The BAFTA Award for Best Makeup and Hair is one of several awards of the British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA).
Winners and nominees.
2011: "The Iron Lady" - Marese Langan
2010: "Alice in Wonderland" - Valli O'Reilly & Paul Gooch
2009: "The Young Victoria" - Jenny Shircore
2008: "The Curious Case of Benjamin Button" – Jean Black and Colleen Callaghan
2007: "The Passionate Life of Edith Piaf (La môme)" – Jan Archibald and Didier Lavergne
2006: "Pan's Labyrinth (El laberinto del fauno)" – José Quetglás and Blanca Sánchez
2005: ' – Howard Berger, Nikki Gooley and Gregory Nicotero
2004: "The Aviator" – Kathryn Blondell, Sian Grigg, and Morag Ross
2003: ' – Ve Neill and Martin Samuel
2002: "Frida" – Judy Chin, Beatrice De Alba, John E. Jackson, and Regina Reyes
2001: ' – Peter King, Peter Owen and Richard Taylor
2000: "How the Grinch Stole Christmas" – Rick Baker, Toni G, Sylvia Nava, Gail Rowell-Ryan and Kazuhiro Tsuji
1999: "Topsy-Turvy" - Christine Blundell
1998 - "Elizabeth" - Jenny Shircore
1997 - "The Wings of the Dove" - Sallie Jaye, Jan Archibald
1996 - "The Nutty Professor" - Rick Baker, David LeRoy Anderson
1995 - "The Madness of King George" - Lisa Westcott
1994 - "The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert" - Cassie Hanlon, Angela Conte, Strykermeyer
1993 - "Orlando" - Morag Ross
1992 - "The Last of the Mohicans" - Peter Robb-King
1991 - "Cyrano de Bergerac" Jean-Pierre Eychenne, Michèle Burke
1990 - "Dick Tracy" - John Caglione, Jr. Doug Drexler
1989 - "The Adventures of Baron Munchausen" - Maggie Weston, Fabrizio Sforza, Pam Meager
1988 - "The Last Emperor" - Fabrizio Sforza
1987 - "Der Name der Rose" - Hasso von Hugo
1986 - "Ran" - Shohichiro Meda, Tameyuki Aimi, Chihako Naito, Noriko Takemizawa
1985 - "Amadeus" - Paul LeBlanc, Dick Smith
1984 ' - Paul Engelen, Peter Frampton, Rick Baker, Joan Hills
1983 - "Tootsie" - Dorothy J. Pearl, George Masters, C. Romania Ford, Allen Allen
1982 - "Quest for Fire" - Sarah Monzani Christopher Tucker, Michèle Burke
